title: Lee Sin promots unsafe, unstrategic and careless play
body:
If you miss Q, don't worry, just ward hop with W.  

If you get out of position don't worry, just ward hop over a wall with W

If your enemy flashes away don't worry, just ward hop with W.

If you flash to get a good ult and don't go far enough, just ward hop behind them with W. 

If you miss Q after your ult, don't worry, just ward hop back to them with W.  

Want to counter jungle but got caught?  Just ward hop away with W.


ADCs lost their lifesteal quints because it was "too good" and was used globally.
ADCs lost their bloodthirster rush because it was "too good" and was used regularly.
APCs lost DFG because it was "too good" and was built regularly.
Lichbane was nerfed because it was "too good" and was used regularly.  
Flash ranged was nerfed because it was "too good".


Lee Sin's W ward hop is useful in any given situation, defensive or offensive or just fixing a fuck up, but he gets to keep it.

K.

That's kinda the issue: the amount of tools the champion has at his disposal (and in many cases, the amount of power in each of those tools) vastly outclasses every other champion in his role, and most champions in general.

Any champion can play safe, any champion can do something stupid.

I neither play him, but my tier shouldn't matter if I'm utilizing critical thought to consider people's opinions, I'm just trying to contribute.

I mean, gravity was discovered because an apple hit someone's head. I don't have to be in LCS to have an opinion or analyze others, do I? Your question is just backhanding me without even talking about him in the first place. My opinion on Lee Sin is that he does have counterplay involved and can get punished for *some *mistakes just like any other champion, but I'd like him to have some small nerfs and get other junglers buffed but I don't make a huge deal out of it.
Ehhh. If it were about playing against him properly, his win rate wouldn't be low at low ELO and high at high ELO, which it is. Lee Sin, when played well, negate his counterplay.

> So yeah, he's right, but that's a *player problem,* not a problem with the *champion.*

Which is exactly the reason they absolutely tore evelynn a new asshole, proceeded to remake her, and then tore her down time and time again. 

Not saying it's a good thing, but it's beyond warranted at this point.

In my honest opinion, Evelynn needs some sort of buff...

Most of her kit is alright, but some of it doesn't make sense. Her Q seems to be made to spam all day instead of a ranged kill secure (a gap closer replacement) with a higher cd, her W seems fine since it works as a decent escape/gap closer, and her E is decent for damage. I just never liked her ult... seems to me it should work like Braum's ult.

But that's my opinion. I mean, Shaco and Twitch work just fine, but I wonder why they can't balance Evelynn well. Maybe they should just switch her passive to an active similar to Shaco?

Honestly if they just removed ward jumping entirely, Lee sin would be alot more tolerable.
They did for a patch. Jax/Kat and Lee couldnt jump and the amount of {{item:3070}} was astronomical.

And riot should have ignored that QQ.  Wardhopping is terrible game mechanic that actually impedes balance because it promotes unhealthy gameplay patterns and detracts from the overall experience of the game.

Wardhopping essentially gives champs the ability to flash an extra time (with an even greater distance to boot!)

Lets take {{champion:24}} .  His Q (leap strike), has a cooldown of 6 seconds at max rank (barring CDR).  Now lets give him the upgraded ward trinket, which stores up to 2 wards and recharges at 1 ward every 60 seconds.

If Jax already has 2 charges fully stored on his trinket, then he can use flash once on a 6 second cooldown, and then once more with a 54 second cooldown (In other words, Jax uses flash, waits 6 seconds, uses it again, and then after 54 seconds, can use flash again if he so chooses).

Now lets say Jax doesn't have the upgraded trinket, and just has the standard trinket, this means Jax can use flash once, with a 120 second cooldown.

That just isn't right.

The difference is that Jax loses his intiate gapcloser when he does this.  By using his jump to escape, he can't turn around and fight; likewise, by initiating, he can't jump out again.

Lee Sin doesn't, because he has two gapclosers and an enemy-reposition.  He can dash in, then dash out if things go wrong, and then kick you away if you dash after him.

It's not so much that he can ward-hop but that he can do it in addition to those other two things that is the real trouble with Lee.

If he is trying to escape....why would he try to turn around to fight again? Wouldn't it have been smarter to not use it to jump at all?   Also.....he can literally just turn around *walk* back if he really wants to press the fight after trying to wardhop to escape it....
Often, you use your escape to avoid enemy CC during a gank, then want to turn and go right back in as your own jungler comes to join in.

So what you are saying is, he used his leap to avoid the enemies form of damage/cc, basically nullifying the enemies skill.

I don't see what your point is here, as the tradeoff is in Jax's favor here, as odds are the spell he just dodged most likely has a longer cooldown in comparison to Jax's leap strike, and also, if he is using it to dodge a skill, with the intention of immediately engaging after dodging it, then he would (in most instances) be able to dodge left or right instead of by moving directly away from the enemy, thus he would be (more or less) no further or closer to the target then from where he started, which basically equates to him not really needing his leap strike to engage on the enemy from that point.

And he would need extreme buffs to make up a huge utility removal. He already has had his utility gutted over and over again. IF you want to make him 100% unviable you obviously don't care about the health of this game. He is versatile but not strong.

"Stand Behind Me" can not be applied to wards because Riot says it makes no sense, which I agree don't get me wrong, but,

Meanwhile "Safeguard" has been doing exactly that for 3 - 4 years now.

I don't always top kek Riot, but when I do, something is horribly wrong.
Lee's W isn't his problem. It's the fact that he has an overloaded kit and no weaknesses.
And his W is part of such kit and its overload and has no weakness :D

Not every ability needs to have a weakness. Entire kits need to have weaknesses, but not singular abilities.

So I was wrong to say his W isn't the problem: It is part of the problem that is his entire kit, but he needs a rework more than a nerf to his W.

The problem with W is that it shouldn't be able to dash to non-champions units. Lee Sin has a 1,100 gap-closer Q. This gap-close has counterplay: avoid it. This counterplay is destroyed by the fact that he still has another dash if he fails the first one.
And being ganked by a Lee that just ward-dashed you with W, smited you and then casted an easy Q onto you is not fun to play against.

Ward hopping is extremely annoying but you also have to realize he's trading an offensive/defensive item for a fail safe or an engage. Yes he is still strong but he isn't impossible to kill. 

However, I think {{item:2045}} should have a 10 - 20 second cooldown between wards being placed. This makes warding for supports more strategic rather than just spamming their button for it, and it nerfs the escapes of champions like {{champion:64}} and {{champion:24}}
